We re-wrote history, and we did it in our own backyard. ✍️

One WORLD RECORD, two world U20 records, and nine national records, what more could we ask for? 

Adizero: Road to Records 2024 you have been special, congrats to all our athletes and thanks to our community. ❤️ https://t.co/oleUv8Kxy3

𝗡𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡𝗔𝗟 𝗥𝗘𝗖𝗢𝗥𝗗 🇿🇦

Ryan Mphahlele takes third place but cements himself as South Africa’s new standard-bearer for the men’s one mile distance. 

Beating his PB by one second, he crosses the finish line in 3:56:40. 🏃

👟#Adizero Takumi Sen 10 #RoadToRecords https://t.co/GoQxhl24jF

𝗨𝟮𝟬 𝗪𝗢𝗥𝗟𝗗 𝗥𝗘𝗖𝗢𝗥𝗗 🌎

At just 18 years old, Collins Kibiwott Koech shows us that the future is bright for running. 

Finishing the day with another record, Collins brought it home in a time of 4:00:10 in the men’s one mile. 🙌

👟#Adizero Takumi Sen 10 #RoadToRecords https://t.co/28rS0nJdtk

𝗪𝗢𝗢𝗢𝗥𝗥𝗥𝗟𝗗 𝗥𝗘𝗖𝗢𝗥𝗗 🌎🤯

Down to the wire. What a way to clinch the title. 🥇

After a finish-line sprint, the Kenyan Emmanuel Wanyonyi steals the victory and claims the record by a second, with an impressive time of 3:54:50  in the men’s one mile distance. https://t.co/pOtnDLNT1W
